comments.body: I know this is a bit weird, but the code itself is BSD. Technically if you pay the licensing fee for FFTW then you can get a permissive license (I believe it is MIT) instead of GPL 2, then this would technically be BSD. However, parts that link and are used with the GPL 2 version of FFTW (not paying the licensing fee) will obviously then be GPL'd.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +34,38 @@about:
    home: http://hgomersall.github.com/pyFFTW/
    license: BSD or GPL 2
    summary: 'A pythonic wrapper around FFTW, the FFT library, presenting a unified interface for all the supported transforms.'
